intro: Urophyllum grandistipulum, commonly known as the large-tipped urophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow to orange inflorescences that are often surrounded by pale green bracts. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Urophyllum grandistipulum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks.
